meanings.sent1: The zookeeper will unleash the lion into its natural habitat.
meanings.sent2: Please unleash the dog from its leash so it can run freely in the park.
meanings.sent3: After being cooped up all day, the children were eager to unleash their energy in the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork unleashed a wave of creativity in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The storm unleashed its fury on the small town, causing widespread damage.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise will unleash a chain reaction of events.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions could unleash chaos in the carefully planned project.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick unexpectedly unleashed a burst of confetti on the audience.
meanings.sent4: The new policy may unleash a wave of innovation within the company.
meanings.sent5: A single spark can unleash a devastating wildfire in dry conditions.

meanings.definition: Express or release a strong emotion or feeling
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but unleash her frustration on her noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, it's necessary to unleash your innermost thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes never fail to unleash a round of laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The music unleashed a flood of memories from her childhood.
meanings.sent5: His speech at the rally unleashed a sense of unity among the crowd.
